extendedIngredients.name: butternut squash
extendedIngredients.originalString: Â½ a butternut squash, peeled and cubed (approx. 4 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 28 oz can diced tomatoes, with their juices

extendedIngredients.name: cornstarch
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tbsp cornstarch or flour mixed with 2 tbsp of water

extendedIngredients.name: maple syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: optional: 2 tsp maple syrup or other sweetener

extendedIngredients.name: white onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 large or 2 small white onions, diced (approx. 2 cups)

recipes.title: Slow Cooker Root Vegetable Stew

winePairing.pairingText: Cabernet Sauvignon, Chablis, and Malbec are my top picks for Stew. Full-bodied red wines like malbec and cabernet sauvignon are the perfect accompaniment for beef stew. Fish stew probably calls for a white wine, such as chablis. The Noble Vines 337 Lodi Cabernet Sauvignon with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Noble Vines 337 Lodi Cabernet Sauvignon
productMatches.description: 337 Cabernet Sauvignon exudes vibrant aromas of black cherry, ripe currant, fresh herbs and lightly roasted coffee. Smooth tannins and balanced acidity support core flavors of blackberry, black cherry and chocolate, intertwined with spicy black pepper accents on the finish. This wine can be enjoyed on its own or with herb-roasted pork loin, baked chicken or barbecued steak and sauteed mushrooms.

recipes.instructions: Add all ingredients except for the cornstarch/flour to a slow cooker and give it a good stir to mix thoroughly.Cook for approximately 3 hours on high and 2 on low. When there's about an hour left, combine the cornstarch or flour with a little water in a small bowl to form a paste then stir into the stew.Let simmer lightly on low for another hour or so. I've eaten this after 3 hours on high and it's totally fine but I loved the flavour and texture after it cooked for another few hours on low. There's no real set time for this, once the vegetables are soft and tender and it's thickened up, it's ready!Serve.

steps.step: Add all ingredients except for the cornstarch/flour to a slow cooker and give it a good stir to mix thoroughly.Cook for approximately 3 hours on high and 2 on low. When there's about an hour left, combine the cornstarch or flour with a little water in a small bowl to form a paste then stir into the stew.

Let simmer lightly on low for another hour or so. I've eaten this after 3 hours on high and it's totally fine but I loved the flavour and texture after it cooked for another few hours on low. There's no real set time for this, once the vegetables are soft and tender and it's thickened up, it's ready!
